info.title: Exchange Rates API
info.description: With over 15 exchange rate data sources, the Exchangerates API is delivering exchanging rates data for more than 170 world currencies. This API has several endpoints, where each of them serves a different purpose, use case. The endpoints include functionalities like receiving the latest exchange rates information for a specific set, or for all currencies; conversion from one to another currency; receiving data Time-series for multiple or for one currency, and preserving the API daily for the fluctuation data.

get.description: The API comes with an updated endpoint that returns all of the available currencies. To receive the list, make an API request to the Supported Symbols endpoint.

schema.description: Supported currency symbols.

success.description: Indicates whether the request was successful.

symbols.description: Map of currency codes to human-readable names.

schema.description: Standard error payload for failed requests.

info.description: Human-readable description of the error and suggested action.
info.example: You have not supplied a valid API Access Key.

get.description: This endpoint, depending on your subscription plan will return real-time exchange rate data which gets updated every 60 minutes, every 10 minutes, or every 60 seconds.

parameters.name: base
parameters.description: Base currency (ISO 4217, e.g., `USD`). If omitted, the provider's default base (often `EUR`) is used. Changing base may be restricted on lower-tier plans.

schema.description: ISO 4217 currency code (or metal code such as XAU/XAG).

parameters.name: symbols
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of target currency codes to filter the response (e.g., `USD,GBP,JPY`).

schema.description: Latest rates snapshot.

timestamp.description: UNIX time (seconds) for the rates snapshot.

base.description: ISO 4217 currency code (or metal code such as XAU/XAG).

date.description: ISO date of the rates snapshot.

rates.description: Map of currency codes to their rate relative to `base`.

schema.description: Standard error payload for failed requests.

info.description: Human-readable description of the error and suggested action.
info.example: You have not supplied a valid API Access Key.

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid API key.

schema.description: Standard error payload for failed requests.

info.description: Human-readable description of the error and suggested action.
info.example: You have not supplied a valid API Access Key.

get.description: With this endpoint we have the possibility to see historical rates of the currencies back to 1999, most of the currencies data are available until 1999. You can query the Exchangerates API for historical rates by appending a date (`YYYY-MM-DD`) to the base URL.

parameters.name: base
parameters.description: Base currency (ISO 4217, e.g., `USD`). If omitted, the provider's default base (often `EUR`) is used. Changing base may be restricted on lower-tier plans.

schema.description: ISO 4217 currency code (or metal code such as XAU/XAG).

parameters.name: symbols
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of target currency codes to filter the response (e.g., `USD,GBP,JPY`).

200.description: Historical rates for the specified date.

schema.description: Historical rates snapshot for a specific date.

timestamp.description: UNIX time (seconds) for the rates snapshot.

base.description: ISO 4217 currency code (or metal code such as XAU/XAG).

rates.description: Map of currency codes to their rate relative to `base`.

schema.description: Standard error payload for failed requests.

info.description: Human-readable description of the error and suggested action.
info.example: You have not supplied a valid API Access Key.

get.description:
This is a separate endpoint for currency conversion that comes with the Exchangerates API and can be used to convert an amount from one currency to another. Please use this API endpoint for the conversion of any currency.
                           
It is also possible to convert currencies using historical exchange rate data. To do this, please also use the API's `date` parameter and set it to your preferred date. (`YYYY-MM-DD`).

schema.description: ISO 4217 currency code (or metal code such as XAU/XAG).
ISO 4217 currency code (or metal code such as XAU/XAG).

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: When provided on **/convert**, performs conversion using the specified historical date (`YYYY-MM-DD`).

200.description: Conversion result for the specified currencies and amount.

schema.description: Currency conversion result and metadata.

from.description: ISO 4217 currency code (or metal code such as XAU/XAG).

to.description: ISO 4217 currency code (or metal code such as XAU/XAG).

info.description: Rate information used for conversion.

timestamp.description: UNIX time (seconds) when the rate was last updated.

rate.description: Conversion rate from `from` to `to` at the time of conversion.

historical.description: Indicates if a historical date was used for conversion.

date.description: Date associated with the applied rate (latest or historical).

schema.description: Standard error payload for failed requests.

info.description: Human-readable description of the error and suggested action.
info.example: You have not supplied a valid API Access Key.

info.example: You have not supplied a valid API Access Key.

get.description: If supported by your subscription plan, the Exchangerates API's Time-Series endpoint lets you query the API for daily historical rates between two dates of your choice, with a maximum time frame of 365 days.

parameters.name: base
parameters.description: Base currency (ISO 4217, e.g., `USD`). If omitted, the provider's default base (often `EUR`) is used. Changing base may be restricted on lower-tier plans.

schema.description: ISO 4217 currency code (or metal code such as XAU/XAG).

parameters.name: symbols
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of target currency codes to filter the response (e.g., `USD,GBP,JPY`).

200.description: Time-series exchange rate data for the requested period.

schema.description: Daily exchange rates over a time window.

start_date.description: Start date of the time window.

end_date.description: End date of the time window.

base.description: ISO 4217 currency code (or metal code such as XAU/XAG).

rates.description: Map keyed by `YYYY-MM-DD`, each containing a currency-to-rate map relative to `base`.

schema.description: Standard error payload for failed requests.

info.description: Human-readable description of the error and suggested action.
info.example: You have not supplied a valid API Access Key.

get.description: With the Fluctuation API endpoint, you can receive information about the currency’s fluctuation on a day-to-day basis. To be able to use this feature, add the `start_date` and `end_date` and select which currencies (symbols) you would like to receive info for from the API. Please note that the maximum allowed timeframe is 365 days.

parameters.name: base
parameters.description: Base currency (ISO 4217, e.g., `USD`). If omitted, the provider's default base (often `EUR`) is used. Changing base may be restricted on lower-tier plans.

schema.description: ISO 4217 currency code (or metal code such as XAU/XAG).

parameters.name: symbols
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of target currency codes to filter the response (e.g., `USD,GBP,JPY`).

200.description: Fluctuation metrics for currencies in the requested period.

schema.description: Fluctuation metrics between two dates.

start_date.description: Start date of the comparison period.

end_date.description: End date of the comparison period.

base.description: ISO 4217 currency code (or metal code such as XAU/XAG).

rates.description: Per-currency fluctuation metrics relative to `base` in the requested period.

schema.description: Standard error payload for failed requests.

info.description: Human-readable description of the error and suggested action.
info.example: You have not supplied a valid API Access Key.

AccessKeyQuery.name: access_key
AccessKeyQuery.description: API access key as **query parameter**. Example: `?access_key=YOUR_KEY`. Required for all endpoints on `api.exchangeratesapi.io/v1`.

Base.name: base
Base.description: Base currency (ISO 4217, e.g., `USD`). If omitted, the provider's default base (often `EUR`) is used. Changing base may be restricted on lower-tier plans.

schema.description: ISO 4217 currency code (or metal code such as XAU/XAG).

Symbols.name: symbols
Symbols.description: Comma-separated list of target currency codes to filter the response (e.g., `USD,GBP,JPY`).

schema.description: ISO 4217 currency code (or metal code such as XAU/XAG).
ISO 4217 currency code (or metal code such as XAU/XAG).
